text:
Daniel "Danny" Leiner (May 13, 1961 – October 18, 2018) was an American movie director. His credits include "The Great New Wonderful", "Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle", "Dude, Where's My Car?", "Layin' Low", and "Time Expired".
Leiner also directed a wide range of television, including "Arrested Development", "Everwood", "Gilmore Girls", "Freaks and Geeks", "Sports Night", "Felicity", "Action", "The Tick", MTV's "Austin Stories" and HBO's "The Mind of the Married Man", "The Sopranos", and "How to Make It in America". He also directed an episode of "The Office" entitled "WUPHF.com."
Early life.
Leiner was born Daniel Leiner in Brooklyn, New York on May 13, 1961.
Death.
On October 18, 2018, Leiner died in Los Angeles, California of cancer at the age of 57.

annotations.surface_form: Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle
The Mind of the Married Man
How to Make It in America
